coredata.dc:title: Comparison of protocols to annotate ischaemic electrocardiogram episodes in the reference ESC DB and LTST DB databases Primerjava protokolov označevanja ishemičnih epizod elektrokardiograma v referenčnih podatkovnih bazah ESC BD in LTST DB

abstract.ce:para: In the field of development and performance evaluation of algorithms and transient ischaemic electrocardiogram ST segment episode analysers, two standardized international reference databases are currently in use: the European Society of Cardiology ST-T database (ESC DB) [1] and the Long-Term ST Database (LTST DB) [2]. The aim of the study was to categorize possible discrepancies between the databases, evaluate these discrepancies, compare both expert protocols to annotate ischaemic episodes (Figure 1), and study how comparable the performance evaluation results, given transient ischaemic ST episode analyser, could be if using these two databases. We compared the databases and protocols on the basis of ten equivalent records (C DB, Table 1) of which source signals are the same for both databases. To effectively synchronize these equivalent records which differ in length, we developed a graphic visualization tool LE (LTST DB - ESC DB) [3] which allows visual identification of significant reference pairs of heart beats in each pair of equivalent records to determine matching intervals. For quantitative evaluation of matching of the expert annotations, we defined specific annotation-matching metrics (Equations 1 and 2) [3]. Besides, the LE tool (Figure 2) allows synchronous display and comparison of episode annotations, display of separately derived [4] time series of diagnostic and morphology feature vectors, navigation along the signals and time series, and computation of the annotation-matching measures. Evaluation of the differences in sampling frequency and in QRS complex amplitude (Table 2) suggested that these differences are due to mechanisms for tape movement and to sampling equipment. The annotation-matching measures showed that the expert annotations of both databases are comparable but moderate divergences in the evaluation results can be expected (Table 3). Slightly higher sensitivities and lower positive predictivities in detecting transient ischaemic ST segment episodes are expected if using the LTST DB as the test database. The experimental results using our own developed system for analysis of transient ST segment changes [5] and standard performance measures to evaluate ischaemia detectors [6, 7] confirmed this hypothesis. The performance results showed (Table 4) higher sensitivity and lower positive predictivity in ischaemic ST episode and ischaemic ST episode duration detection if using the LTST DB. We conclude that these differences are mostly due to discrepancies in the annotation protocols. Results of the study are consistent with findings of other researchers which reported lower sensitivities of their recognition algorithms in detecting transient ischaemic episodes [8, 9] if using the ESC DB.

authkeywords.author-keyword: Transient ischaemic ST segment change analysers

abstract.ce:para: In the field of development and performance evaluation of algorithms and transient ischaemic electrocardiogram ST segment episode analysers, two standardized international reference databases are currently in use: the European Society of Cardiology ST-T database (ESC DB) [1] and the Long-Term ST Database (LTST DB) [2]. For quantitative evaluation of matching of the expert annotations, we defined specific annotation-matching metrics (Equations 1 and 2) [3]. Besides, the LE tool (Figure 2) allows synchronous display and comparison of episode annotations, display of separately derived [4] time series of diagnostic and morphology feature vectors, navigation along the signals and time series, and computation of the annotation-matching measures. ref-title.ref-titletext: The European ST-T database: Standard for evaluating systems for the analysis of ST-T changes in ambulatory electrocardiography

reference.ref-fulltext: A. Taddei, G. Distante, M. Emdin, P. Pisani, G. B. Moody, C. Zeelenberg, C. Marchesi, The European ST-T database: standard for evaluating systems for the analysis of ST-T changes in ambulatory electrocardiography, European Heart Journal, 13:1164-1172, 1992.

ref-title.ref-titletext: Long-term ST database: A reference for the development and evaluation of automated ischaemia detectors and for the study of the dynamics of myocardial ischaemia

reference.ref-fulltext: F. Jager, A. Taddei, G. B. Moody, M. Emdin, G. Antolic, R. Dorn, A. Smrdel, C. Marchesi, R. G. Mark, Long-term ST database: A reference for the development and evaluation of automated ischaemia detectors and for the study of the dynamics of myocardial ischaemia, Medical & Biological Engineering & Computing, 41:172-182, 2003.

ref-title.ref-titletext: Primerjava protokolov označevanja prehodnih epizod segmenta ST elektrokardiograma v podatkovnih bazah LTST DB in ESC DB, Diplomsko delo

ref-info.ref-sourcetitle: Fakulteta Za Računalništvo in Informatiko, Univerza v Ljubljani

reference.ref-fulltext: M. Amon, Primerjava protokolov označevanja prehodnih epizod segmenta ST elektrokardiograma v podatkovnih bazah LTST DB in ESC DB, Diplomsko delo, Fakulteta za računalništvo in informatiko, Univerza v Ljubljani, Ljubljana, 2003.

ref-title.ref-titletext: Detection of transient ST segment episodes during ambulatory ECG monitoring

reference.ref-fulltext: F. Jager, G.B. Moody, R.G. Mark, Detection of transient ST segment episodes during ambulatory ECG monitoring, Computers and Biomedical Research, 31:305-322, 1998.

ref-title.ref-titletext: Automated detection of transient ST-segment episodes in 24 h electrocardiograms

reference.ref-fulltext: A. Smrdel, F. Jager, Automated detection of transient ST-segment episodes in 24 h electrocardiograms, Medical & Biological Engineering & Computing 42:303-311, 2004.

ref-title.ref-titletext: Performance measures for algorithms to detect transient ischemie ST segment changes

reference.ref-fulltext: F. Jager, G.B. Moody, A. Taddei, R.G. Mark, Performance measures for algorithms to detect transient ischemie ST segment changes, Computers in Cardiology 1991, pages 369-372, 1991.

ref-info.ref-sourcetitle: Association for the Advancement of Medical Instrumentation /American National Standard Institute

reference.ref-fulltext: ANSI/AAMI EC57:1998, Ambulatory electrocardiographs, Association for the Advancement of Medical Instrumentation /American National Standard Institute, Arlington, VA, 1998.

ref-title.ref-titletext: Automatic detection of ST-T complex changes on the ECG using filtered RMS difference series: Application to ambulatory ischemia monitoring

reference.ref-fulltext: J. García, L. Sörnmo, S. Olmos, P. Laguna, Automatic detection of ST-T complex changes on the ECG using filtered RMS difference series: application to ambulatory ischemia monitoring, IEEE Transactions on Biomedical Engineering, 47(9): 1195-1201, 2000.

ref-title.ref-titletext: An ischemia detection method based on artificial neural networks

reference.ref-fulltext: C. Papaloukas, D.I. Fotiadis, A. Likas, L.K. Michalis, An ischemia detection method based on artificial neural networks, Artificial Intelligence in Medicine, 24:167-178, 2002.
